title: Showers expected in several areas after 2pm today
byline: Showers or thundershowers are likely at a few places in the Southern province and in the Ratnapura and Monaragala districts after 2.00 p.m.

title: Man beaten to death in Horana; Two women arrested
byline: A 32-year-old man has been allegedly beaten to death at a residence in Poruwadanda, Horana, police stated.

title: PUCSL to begin public consultations on proposed electricity tariff hike today
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) will hold public consultation sessions from today (Feb. 20) to March 18 on the proposal submitted by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to revise electricity tariffs for the second quarter of 2026.

title: Sri Lanka abstains in UN vote on immediate ceasefire between Ukraine and Russia
byline: Sri Lanka and India abstained in the UN General Assembly on a draft resolution that called for an immediate, full and unconditional ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo today for Sri Lanka–New Zealand World Cup clash
byline: A special traffic plan will be in place today in view of tomorrow’s World Cup T20 encounter between Sri Lanka and New Zealand in Colombo.

title: President Trump set to deliver first State of the Union address of his second term
byline: US President Donald Trump will deliver the traditional State of the Union address to Congress on Tuesday at a fraught moment for his presidency, with his approval ratings slumping, anxieties rising over Iran, and Americans struggling with the cost of living as the November midterm election nears.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourist arrivals in 2026 surpass 500,000
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) says that the total number of foreign tourist arrivals to the island has crossed the 500,000-mark so far this year.

title: Two dead after winter storm hammers the US northeast
byline: A powerful winter blizzard that hit the north-eastern US has left two dead in Maryland and continues to delay flights and cause widespread power outages across the region.

title: Prof. Susiripala Manawadu assumes duties as new Governor of Southern Province
byline: Professor Susiripala Manawadu officially assumed duties as the Governor of the Southern Province this morning (25) at the Southern Province Governor’s Secretariat in Galle.

title: Sri Lanka’s export earnings top US$ 1.5 billion mark in January
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector commenced 2026 on a strong momentum, recording a robust year-on-year growth of 13.71%, signaling renewed momentum in external trade performance, the Sri Lanka Export Development Board (EDB) stated.

title: Deputy Defence Minister chairs special meeting to resolve land issues faced by war heroes
byline: A special meeting was convened under the chairmanship of the Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd), to discuss land-related issues identified by the Ranaviru Seva Authority affecting war heroes and their family members, and to provide prompt solutions.

title: PM Modi to begin his Israel visit today, defence and trade on agenda
byline: India and Israel’s relations will be upgraded to a “special strategic partnership” during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit, marking a “significant leap ahead” similar to Jerusalem’s ties with countries such as the US and Germany, sources said here Tuesday.

title: “Tariffs will replace income tax, will take burden off Americans”: Trump in key speech
byline: US President Donald Trump, during his annual State of the Union address, defended his sweeping tariffs on foreign countries, saying those who “ripped the US for years are now paying billions of dollars.

title: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath to leave for Germany tomorrow
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath will undertake a visit to Germany from 26-27 February 2026 to participate in a series of meetings related to trade and foreign employment, pursuant to an invitation extended by the German-Asia Pacific Business Association of Germany (OAV) Bremen Chapter.

title: Former Head of State Intelligence Suresh Sallay arrested by CID
byline: The Former Head of the State Intelligence Service, Major General (Retired) Suresh Sallay has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: US sets initial duties on Indian solar imports at 126%
byline: The Trump administration set preliminary duties of 126% on solar imports from India after determining the country unfairly subsidized manufacturing.

title: Appeals Court dismisses Avant-Garde writ petitions without formal hearing
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered the dismissal of two writ petitions filed by Avant-Garde and its employees, without a formal hearing.

title: Underworld activities and drug trafficking expanded due to political patronage– Minister
byline: Organized criminals and drug traffickers were utilized in the past for certain factions to consolidate their political power, the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala stated.

title: Former Social Services Officer arrested on bribery charges
byline: A former Social Services Officer attached to the Katana Divisional Secretariat has been arrested on bribery charges.

title: Energy efficiency is a national priority for development – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that enhancing energy efficiency is an essential factor in strengthening the country’s economy, and that it is not merely about limiting consumption but about making a distinctive contribution to the national development process.

title: Opposition leaders meet ex-President Ranil to coordinate strategy on national issues
byline: A group of leaders of opposition parties held a high-level meeting with former President Ranil Wickremesinghe this morning (25) to discuss strategies for coordinated action across opposition parties.

title: FM Vijitha Herath to undertake an official visit to Romania
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath will undertake an official visit to Romania from 1–3 March, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement.

title: Petrol bomb attack on Gintota house; Police launch probe
byline: A petrol bomb attack was carried out on a house in Gintota, Galle in the early hours of today (25), police said.

title: UK to enforce travel permit requirement on foreign visitors
byline: Starting on Wednesday (Feb 25), visitors to Britain from 85 countries, including Singapore, must obtain an electronic permit in advance of their trip or they will be barred from travelling, the UK interior ministry said.

title: Public warned of scammers posing as senior police officers
byline: Sri Lanka Police have reportedly received information regarding organized groups operating within Colombo, specially contacting tourist hotels and other private institutions, while impersonating senior police officers.

title: CEB trade unions to stage six-hour token strike tomorrow
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) trade unions have decided to launch a token strike from 12 noon to 6.00 p.m. tomorrow (26), citing the lack of response to their demands.

title: US ‘leading the fight’ against Southeast Asian scam compounds - FBI official
byline: A senior FBI official said on Tuesday that the United States was “committed to leading the fight” against multi-billion dollar Southeast Asian fraud factories targeting Americans.

title: Mexico weighs legal action after Elon Musk links president to drug cartels
byline: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has stated that she is considering legal action following a comment by tech billionaire Elon Musk, the world’s richest man, that alleged she was connected to drug cartels.

title: CID launches probe into death threats against Public Security Minister and Deputy Minister
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into alleged death threats made against Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala and Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala.

title: Daisy Forrest released from money laundering case
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered the release of Daisy Forrest, the grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa and a defendant in a case filed under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Ali Sabry slams Suresh Sallay’s arrest as ‘theatrics designed to mislead or divide’
byline: Former Justice Minister Ali Sabry says that undermining officers who once safeguarded the country may offer temporary political advantage, but it weakens morale within the armed forces and sends a troubling signal to those tasked with protecting the nation.

title: Sri Lanka and Portugal move to strengthen cooperation in tourism sector
byline: The Minister of State and Foreign Affairs of Portugal, Paulo Rangel, has met with the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, at the Prime Minister’s Office for bilateral discussions.

title: Suresh Sallay arrested under PTA, to be held for 72 hours for questioning - Police
byline: Former Head of the State Intelligence Service (SIS) Major General (Retired) Suresh Sallay was arrested this morning (25) under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), police stated.

title: Dilith Jayaweera condemns ‘politically motivated’ arrest of Suresh Sallay
byline: The leader of the Sarvajana Balaya and Member of Parliament, Dilith Jayaweera, today (13) strongly condemned the arrest and 72-hour detention of former state intelligence chief Major General (Retd) Suresh Sallay, which he claims is “under the pretext” of questioning him in connection with the Easter Sunday attacks.

title: Japan to deploy missiles on island near Taiwan by 2031
byline: Japan plans to deploy surface-to-air missiles to its remote western island near Taiwan by March 2031, its defence minister said, as regional tensions simmer.

title: CID launches probe into death threats against Public Security Minister and Deputy Defence Minister
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into alleged death threats made against Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala and Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General (Retd) Aruna Jayasekara.

title: Police reveal major breakthrough in Akuregoda double murder investigation
byline: Senior Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Police in charge of the Western Province, Sajeewa Medawatte, says that several new information have been uncovered in connection with the recent shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife at a supermarket parking lot in Akuregoda.

title: Warner Bros gets higher offer from Paramount in heated fight for storied Hollywood studio
byline: Warner Bros. Discovery said that Paramount has raised the price of its takeover offer to $31 per share, potentially setting the stage for a fresh bidding war with Netflix over the future of the Hollywood giant.

title: Google disrupts hackers that attacked 53 groups globally
byline: Google disrupted a Chinese-linked hacking group that breached at least 53 organizations across 42 countries, the company said Wednesday.

title: Court orders CID to release property seized from house linked to Easter attacks suspect
byline: Colombo Fort Magistrate Isuru Neththikumara today (25) ordered the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to release the gold, gemstones and other property seized by the CID from a residence in the Mahawila Gardens housing scheme in Dematagoda, linked to a suspect in the Easter Sunday terror attacks.

title: US tariff rate to hit 15% or more for some nations, USTR says
byline: The U.S. tariff rate for some countries will rise to 15% or higher from the newly imposed 10%, U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Wednesday, without naming any specific trading partners or giving further details.

title: Sri Lanka and Russia discuss cooperation in tourism, trade and technology
byline: The Ambassador of the Russian Federation to Sri Lanka, Levan S. Dzhagaryan, has met the Secretary to the President, Dr Nandika Sanath Kumanayake, today (25) at the Presidential Secretariat.
